intro: Oudemansia integerrima, commonly known as the rock fern, is a perennial plant native to rocky and mountainous regions. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant features rhizomes that form dense mats, supporting its growth on rocky substrates. Its fronds are typically leathery and have a dark green color with a slightly serrated edge. Oudemansia integerrima is well adapted to harsh environments, making it a resilient species in alpine and subalpine habitats.
